entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 7:18PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS DEVELOPING WITH SNOW AND BLOWING SNOW CHANGING TO RAIN TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... A strong low pressure system is poised to move along the Aleutian Chain Tuesday morning before entering the southern Bering Sea Tuesday evening and overnight. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 7:18PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS AND HEAVY PRECIPITATION TUESDAY THROUGH WEDNESDAY... A strong low pressure system is poised to move along the Aleutian Chain Tuesday morning before entering the southern Bering Sea Tuesday evening and overnight. entry.summary: ...SLICK TRAVEL EXPECTED TONIGHT... Snow showers will result in one to three inches of snowfall along and west of the Allegheny Front through daybreak. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 1:00AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SLICK TRAVEL EXPECTED TONIGHT... Snow showers will result in one to three inches of snowfall along and west of the Allegheny Front through daybreak. This will likely lead to slick roads, especially in times of higher snow rates. The steadiest snow is expected through 4 AM, possibly lessening thereafter.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued January 01 at 12:14AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Localized persistent narrow band of snow impacting Central VT... A localized persistent narrow band of snow has led to locally over 6 inches of accumulation over the last 24 hours along the Route 108 corridor in Stowe as well as portions of Route 100 and Interstate 89 near Waterbury, VT. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 8:29PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: Periods of light rain and snow will continue moving east across the area tonight. Any snow accumulations are expected to be light, perhaps up to 1 inch into early Monday morning. However, surface temperatures falling below freezing could yield scattered slick and hazardous conditions, as wet areas refreeze overnight.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 31 at 8:20PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...SLICK TRAVEL CONDITIONS TONIGHT... A combination of snow and temperatures falling below freezing will create slick roads this evening and overnight, especially across the higher ridge tops where colder temperatures are expected. Use caution if traveling, and allow extra time to reach your destination.
